subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text:
{{Han char|rn=72|rad=日|as=00|sn=4|four=60100|canj=A|ids=⿴囗一}}

# {{mul-kangxi radical-def}}

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text: * [[Index:Chinese radical/日]]

subSections.title: See also
subSections.text: * Not to be confused with {{l|mul|曰}}, which is generally wider and shorter

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – the Sun. A dot or line was added in the centre to distinguish it from visually similar characters, e.g. {{l|zh|囗}} (early form of {{l|zh|丁}}). Compare earlier forms of the character with the astronomical and astrological symbol for the Sun ([[☉]]).

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|alt=囸,𡆠,𡇁,𡆸,𡇗,𡈎,㒲-“fuck”,入-“fuck”}}
; “Sun; day; etc.”
: From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*nəj}}.

; “to fuck”
: Essentially a substitute character for {{ltc-l|入|to enter}}, that preserves the expected modern pronunciation of {{lang|zh|入}}; see the etymology there for more.
